io.libraft.agent
Class RaftAgent

java.lang.Object
  io.libraft.agent.RaftAgent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Raft
public class RaftAgent
extends Object
implements Raft

Component for controlling and interacting with the Raft cluster.

This class:

  • Instantiates and manages the lifecycle for service implementations required by RaftAlgorithm.
  • Allows callers to interact with the Raft cluster via the Raft interface.
RaftAgent requires that Command instances be serialized and deserialized into a suitable form for network transmission and durable storage. Two Command types are supported:
  • Jackson-annotated classes.
  • POJOs.

Jackson-annotated classes

RaftAgent supports Jackson-annotated classes that derive from a single base class. To setup serialization and deserialization for these classes callers should call setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(Class) with the base class of the Command hierarchy as the parameter. For example: 
     // command hierarchy
     CMD_BASE
     +-- CMD_SUB1
     +-- CMD_SUB2

     // serialization/deserialization setup
     raftAgent.setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(CMD_BASE.class);

POJOs

RaftAgent supports arbitrary POJOs tagged with the Command interface. Callers must implement CommandSerializer and CommandDeserializer to transform their POJOs to and from binary. To setup serialization and deserialization for these classes callers should call setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(CommandSerializer, CommandDeserializer) with their CommandSerializer and CommandDeserializer implementation instances as parameters.

RaftAgent should only be initialized with one of:

  • setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(Class)
  • setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(CommandSerializer, CommandDeserializer)
For examples on setting up both kinds of serialization and deserialization see RaftAgentTest.

This component is thread-safe.

Method Detail

fromConfigurationFile

public static RaftAgent fromConfigurationFile(String configFile,
                                              RaftListener raftListener)
                                       throws IOException
Create an instance of RaftAgent from a configuration file.

Parameters:
configFile - location of the JSON configuration file. The configuration in this file will be validated. See the project README.md for more on the configuration file
raftListener - instance of RaftListener that will be notified of events from the Raft cluster
Returns:
valid RaftAgent that can be used to connect to, and (if leader), replicate Command instances to the Raft cluster
Throws:
IOException - if the configuration file cannot be loaded or processed (i.e. contains invalid JSON)

fromConfigurationObject

public static RaftAgent fromConfigurationObject(RaftConfiguration configuration,
                                                RaftListener raftListener)
Create an instance of RaftAgent from a RaftConfiguration object. This method can be used when the RaftAgent configuration is part of a larger configuration.

Parameters:
configuration - instance of RaftConfiguration with the configuration to be used. This object will be validated
raftListener - instance of RaftListener that will be notified of events from the Raft cluster
Returns:
valid RaftAgent that can be used to connect to, and (if leader), replicate Command instances to the Raft cluster

setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization

public <CommandSubclass extends Command> void setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(Class<CommandSubclass> commandSubclassKlass)
Setup serialization and deserialization for Jackson-annotated Command objects. This method should only be called once.

Type Parameters:
CommandSubclass - the base-class type of the Jackson-annotated Command classes
Parameters:
commandSubclassKlass - the base class of the Jackson-annotated Command classes
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called multiple times
See Also:

setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization

public void setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(CommandSerializer commandSerializer,
                                                              CommandDeserializer commandDeserializer)
Setup custom serialization and deserialization for POJO Command objects. This method should only be called once.

Parameters:
commandSerializer - CommandSerializer that can serialize a POJO Command into binary
commandDeserializer - CommandDeserializer that can deserialize binary into a Command POJO
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called multiple times
See Also:
RaftRPC.setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(ObjectMapper, CommandSerializer, CommandDeserializer)

initialize

public void initialize()
                throws StorageException
Initialize the local Raft server.

Sets up the service implementation classes, creates database tables and starts any thread pools necessary. Following this call all service classes are fully initialized. Even though various threads are started they will not use or interact with the service implementation classes. Callers still have exclusive access to the system.

This method should only be called once before start().

Throws:
StorageException - if the persistence components cannot be initialized
IllegalStateException - if this method is called multiple times

start

public void start()
Start the local Raft server.

This call must only be made after:

  1. one of setupJacksonAnnotatedCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(Class) or setupCustomCommandSerializationAndDeserialization(CommandSerializer, CommandDeserializer)
  2. initialize()
Following a successful call to start() callers no longer have exclusive access to system resources.

Once a successful call to start() is made subsequent calls are noops.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - if this method is called before RaftAgent is initialized

stop

public void stop()
Stop the local Raft server.

Stops and terminates all thread pools and cancels all timers. Pending timeout tasks will be dropped. Following a successful call to stop() callers will have exclusive access to system resources again. Callers may choose to release this RaftAgent instance or call start() again later to restart the RaftAgent - either is supported.

Once a successful call to stop() is made subsequent calls are noops.
